result.execSummary:
The defendant August D. Genz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant August D. Genz in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Defendant August D. Genz in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:37 p.m. PSI report has been received. No corrections from Counsel. No testimony offered. Sentencing arguments by State, 38 days credit for time served. State recommends withheld sentence, 5 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, counseling deemed appropriate, court costs, 1 yr jail. Ct 2 - withheld, 3 yrs probation, concurrent, counseling, court costs. Counsel stipulate 50 days credit if revoked. Atty Grubofski makes sentencing arguments. Asks for 2 months jail, bond applied to costs and for huber privileges for work and medical. Statement by Defendant. Atty Grubofski reads statement by Defendant. Court asks questions of Defendant. Court orders on  Withheld prison sentence, On ct 1 - 1 yr probation, 120 days jail. Court gives reasons for sentence. Other conditions - court costs, counseling as required, AODA. Ct 2 - 1 yr probation, concurrent, 120 days jail, concurrent to ct 1, counseling as recommended, court costs. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. DNA sample unless already given. DNA surcharge on ct 1 - only if sample is given. DNA colloquy.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights. Apply bond to costs. Huber if eligible for work or community service if allowed. 50 days credit if revoked.
(JA gave 2 copies to DA - he will give copy to defense counsel)

# 1 - Photocopy of cell phone
# 2 - Group of photocopies showing texts
# 3 - Group of photocopies showing cell phone & texts
# 4 - Statement of Qualifications of Billie Robbins
# 5 - Manilla envelope containg plastic bag of evidence tested (Located at S.D.)
# 6 - Laboratory report by crime lab of findings with receipt for evidence
# 7 - Manilla Envelope containing cell phone in plactic bag (Located at S.D.)
# 8 - Group of photocopies of Cell phone & text messages (15 pages)

Defendant August D. Genz in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  9:37 a.m./Bailiff opens court.  Court advises jurors of case and introduces parties.  All prospective jurors sworn.  Voir dire begins.  10:21 a.m./Jury selected.  Balance of jurors excused.  10:24 a.m./Recess.  Jurors taken to jury room.  10:45 a.m./Reconvene.  All parties present.  Jury returns.  Court gives jury preliminary instructions.  10:49 a.m./Opening statement by State.  10:55 a.m./Opening statement by Def.'s Atty.  11:01 a.m./Officer Christopher May, duly sworn on oath, testifies.  11:07 a.m./M.B., duly sworn on oath, testifies.  Ex. 1 - photocopy of cell phone.  Ex. 2 - group of photocopies showing text messages.  Ex. 2 offered by State and received subject to cross examination.  Ex. 3 - group of photocopies showing cell phone and text messages.  Ex. 3 offered by State and received.  11:41 a.m./Billie Robbins of the State Crime Lab, duly sworn on oath, testifies.  Ex. 4 - Statement of Qualification of Billie Robbins.  Court finds this is an expert witness.  Ex. 5 - Manilla envelope containing plastic bag of evidence tested by Crime Lab.  Ex. 6 - Laboratory report of findings along with receipt for evidence.  Ex. 6 - offered by State and received.  Ex. 5 offered by State and received.  Ex. 4 offered by State and received.  11:52 a.m./Court instructs jury in regard to discussing case.  Court excuses jurors for lunch, to resume at 1:15 p.m.  Previous sidebar put on record.  Def.'s Atty. makes record in regard to representation.  11:56 a.m./Recess.  1:46 p.m./Reconvene.  All parties present.  Jury returns.  Deputy Greg Carter, duly sworn on oath, testifies.  Ex. 7 - Manilla envelope containing cell phone in plastic bag.  Ex. 1 offered by State and received.  Ex. 7 offered by State and received.  Ex. 8 - group of photocopies of cell phone and text messages (15 pages).  Ex. 8 offered by State and received.  2:31 p.m./All exhibits have been offered and received.  State rests.  Jury taken to jury room.  Defense moves for direct verdict.  State disagrees and responds.  Court denies defense motion for directed verdict at this time.  Record made in regard to Def.'s decision as to testifying or not.  Court gives Def. right to testify or remain silent.  Def. does not wish to testify at this time.  Def. will talk to his attorney in regard to testifying.  2:37 p.m./Recess.  2:55 p.m./Reconvene.  All parties present.  Def. and his attorney have discussed whether Def. will testify or not.  Def. has decided not to testify.  Court indicates jury instruction 315 will be used.  Testimony is closed.  Court will proceed with jury instruction conference.  Parties agree to format of verdicts.  Court goes through jury instructions to be used.  3:11 p.m./Jury returns.  Defense has no testimony.  Testimony closed.  Court gives jury instructions.  3:29 p.m./Closing arguments by State. 3:49 p.m./Closing argument by Atty Bennett. 3:56 p.m. Rebuttal by State. Court reads verdict to jury. Jury instructions read to jury. Bailiff's sworn in @ 4:06 pm. Jurors deliberate @ 4:07 pm.  State would like discuss Poss w/intent to delivery jury instruction.  Atty Bennett has no objection.  Court will not send exhibits back until jurors ask for them. Court has note from jury - jurors would like text messages.  Court will allow Exhibits #2, 3 & 8 to jury.  Court will send jury instructions to jury. Off the record @ 4:12 pm. Reconvene @ 4:31 pm.Court has the verdict, State present, Atty Bennett with def & jury present. Court read verdict @ 4:33 pm.  Guilty w/poss intent to delivery, yes near a school, Guilty Conspiracy to deliver THC, Jury polled. All ayes. Jury is excused @ 4:36 pm. State moves for entry of judgment on verdict.  Court orders clerk to enter judgment from verdict.  State requests bond be revoked and order PSI.  Atty Bennett gives argument.  Def. is not employed.  Def. rents. State gives criminal history.  Atty Bennett replies.  Court questions if def. can post high cash bond.  Def. has no other funds to post bond. Court will order def. remanded to S.D. immed. Court will order def. be taken into custody. Court will order PSI. Court revokes $200.00 cash bond & will address in later date. Off the record @ 4:45 pm.  Back on the record @ 4:46 pm Exh's #5 & 7 Court will return those exhibits to be taken back into Sheriff's Dept custody.  Deputy Westen takes chain of custody of exhibits.  No objection by either party. State request exhibits. Court will order be held until further order by court. Def. taken into custody @ 4:56 pm.

Defendant August D. Genz in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 10:38 am  Def will waive right to preliminary hearing.  Court explains right to preliminary.  Def waives.  Court accepts waiver of preliminary.  Court finds probable cause.  Information filed.  Waive reading.  Special apperance reserve jurisdictional objections.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Court will accept not guilty plea.  Bond will continue with conditions  Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
No possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.    No delivery of prescription drugs to individuals with no valid prescription

Defendant August D. Genz in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint received.  Waive reading.  Reserve jurisdictional objections.  Time limits for preliminary waived.  Preliminary set.  Review of bond.  Arguments presented by Atty Bennett.  Response by DA.  Court will reduce bond.  Balance to be returned to poster  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 10:30 am.
